page.title: 03LOCAL HISTORY 2
page.content: The village remained basically an agricultural community until the middle of the 20th century.The notable exceptions to this were the building of an explosives factory on the marshes to the east of the village in the years before the First World War and the development of the large oil refineries on the same site after the Second World War.These projects obviously brought industry to the area. However,it was the development of Stanford le Hope and its neighbouring village of Corringham into dormitory settlements of London that led to the building of large housing estates.This has developed to such an extent that both villages have now merged to form one continuous built up area.
